reviewText: Course badly managed, not to say neglected.
I am delayed in my submission and my certificate is locked. Please do not invest in this course

It is the worst course ever.It shows palgirism when I set my dedication project to them for the purpose of Certificate at that time. It is a worst course ever I will not want to do after all when I want unenroll it , it does not unenroll. Its really a worst course ever.
It's very Boring course. I don't even want to continue it anymore. So much big lectures and there is no twists. If there is an option to rate it 0, I would do that.
boring...
It's boring

The class is interesting, but the main problem with the assignments is that you have people with little to no experience that end up reviewing your work every single time.For instance for the second week's drawing assignment, a lot of people who didn't have talent or knowledge about the basics of drawing submitted their work. They didn't even follow the tutorials or the instructions given and because this the quality of their drawings was very low.  Based on what they uploaded, I left them an honest feedback and I tried not to mess their final score too much. Now some of these people (I do remember their names, that's how bad their work was) are not grading me correctly and I really don't understant why. I graduated from art school. With all due respect, I believe that the instructor of this course should be the one who grades some of the assignments. I'm trying to unenroll from this course but I'm having a hard time, it wouldn't let me.

A very interesting course for an introduction to industrial/product design. It carries you from what specific problem you want to find solution to (it could be very simple), up to developing an artifact that can address the stated problem. It could be so demanding also since it requires you to interview people, come up with numerous drawings, make several prototypes, and you're obliged to make many peer reviews. I think this could be lessen so it will not be a tedious course especially for people who are also working.
nice to learn in this app.
Great and waiting for new courses from you

I liked the course more than I expected! the professor is amazing with bringing the information. I think it's really helpful that he kept the same example going on through the whole course so we can see all the changes and developments in his own prototype so we can compare and learn.Sometimes I think their are too many unnecessary details, or that it took so long to get to the point. But overall the course is very interesting for everyone who is interested in designing products or artifacts as he likes to call them.The course period is a little but long, but the videos length is good, not too long not too short.I'm new to the online courses thing, and I'm considered young to those topics but I found it quite beneficial!
It has all the concepts involved in design and prototyping, has good examples ans some funny moments. I would recomend it to people that really want to learn about the topic, but not to anyone.
Very useful. Mr Ulrich is a good teacher and explains everything with simple examples. Thank you!

Excellent course as in introduction to design, with clear lectures and assignments. Would be good to have some direct feedback from the course tutor though.
